# searchBarStyle

**Instance Property**

A search bar style that specifies the search bar’s appearance.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var searchBarStyle: UISearchBar.Style { get set }
```

## Discussion

This property can be used together with [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchBar/barStyle]. The style [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchBar/Style/minimal] provides no default background color or image but will display one if customized as such.

Custom background and search field images take precedence over this property.

See [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchBar/Style] for possible values. The default value is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISearchBar/Style/default].

## Configuring the search bar

- **isEnabled**: A Boolean value indicating whether the search bar is in the enabled state.
- **barTintColor**: The tint color to apply to the search bar background.
- **UISearchBar.Style**: Specifies whether the search bar has a background.
- **tintColor**: The tint color to apply to key elements in the search bar.
- **isTranslucent**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the search bar is translucent (true) or not (false).
- **barStyle**: A bar style that specifies the search bar’s appearance.
- **UIBarStyle**: Defines the stylistic appearance of different types of views.
